[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Dol Baran.jpg|thumb|360px|As depicted in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''Dol Baran''' was the last southernmost hill of the [[Misty Mountains]].<ref name=Palantir>{{TT|Palantir}}, p. 589</ref>

==Geography==
Dol Baran was round, crowned with heather with green lower slopes. It was located southwest of the southwestern end of [[Nan Curunir]] about a mile west of the road that ran from [[Isengard]] to the [[Fords of Isen]].<ref name=Palantir/>

==History==
After the visit to [[Isengard]] the party accompanying King [[Théoden]] camped in a dale on its southern side for the night<ref name=Palantir/> on [[5 March]].<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 5, p. 1093</ref> It was here that [[Peregrin Took]] looked into the [[Palantír of Orthanc]] and later that a [[Nazgûl]] flew over on its way to see [[Saruman]]<ref name=Palantir/>

==Etymology==
''Dol Baran'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests that it means "Bare Hill".<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-138944825.html|articlename=S. ''Dol Baran'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=02 September 2023}}</ref> It is a compound of ''[[dol]]'' ("head", "hill") and ''[[paran]]'' ("naked", "bare", "smooth", "shaven") referring to its lack of trees.<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Dol Baran'', p. 433</ref>

==Portrayals in Adaptations==
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'''''
:A landmark within the Heathfells area of the [[Gap of Rohan]], Dol Baran is a site of skirmish between [[Rohirrim]] and [[Dunlendings|Dunlending]] forces.
